045/**
046 * This class defines static utility methods adding to ImageJs functionality.
047 * @author WB
048 *
049 */
050public abstract class IjUtils {
051        
052        private IjUtils() {}
053        
054        /**
055         * Returns a (possibly empty) array of ImagePlus objects that are sorted by
056         * their titles if the 'sortByTitle' flag is set.
057         * 
058         * @param sortByTitle flag, result is sorted if true.
059         * @return an array of currently open images.
060         */
061        public static ImagePlus[] getOpenImages(boolean sortByTitle) {
062                return getOpenImages(sortByTitle, null);
063        }
064        
065        /**
066         * Returns an array of strings containing the short titles of the images
067         * supplied.
068         * 
069         * @param images array of images.
070         * @return array of names.
071         */
072        public static String[] getImageShortTitles(ImagePlus[] images) {
073                String[] imageNames = new String[images.length];
074                for (int i = 0; i < images.length; i++) {
075                        imageNames[i] = images[i].getShortTitle();
076                }
077                return imageNames;
078        }
079        
080        /**
081         * Opens a dialog to let the user select one of the currently open images.
082         * 
083         * @param title string to show in the dialog
084         * @return a {@link ImagePlus} object, use the getProcessor method to obtain the
085         *         associated {@link ImageProcessor}
086         */
087        public static ImagePlus selectOpenImage(String title) {
088                ImagePlus[] openImages = getOpenImages(true, null);
089                String[] imageNames = getImageShortTitles(openImages);
090                if (title == null) {
091                        title = "image:";
092                }
093                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog("Select image");
094                gd.addChoice(title, imageNames, imageNames[0]);
095                gd.showDialog(); 
096                if (gd.wasCanceled()) 
097                        return null;
098                else {
099                        return openImages[gd.getNextChoiceIndex()];
100                }
101        }
102        
103        
104        /**
105         * Returns a (possibly empty) array of {@link ImagePlus} objects that are sorted
106         * by their titles if the sortByTitle flag is set. The image "exclude"
107         * (typically the current image) is not included in the returned array (pass
108         * null to exclude no image).
109         * 
110         * @param sortByTitle set {@code true} to return images sorted by title
111         * @param exclude     reference to an image to be excluded (may be {@code null})
112         * @return a (possibly empty) array of {@link ImagePlus} objects
113         */
114        public static ImagePlus[] getOpenImages(boolean sortByTitle, ImagePlus exclude) {
115                List<ImagePlus> imgList = new LinkedList<ImagePlus>();
116                int[] wList = WindowManager.getIDList();
117        if (wList != null) {
118                for (int i : wList) {
119                    ImagePlus imp = WindowManager.getImage(i);
120                    if (imp != null && imp != exclude) {
121                        imgList.add(imp);
122                    }
123                }
124        }
125        ImagePlus[] impArr = imgList.toArray(new ImagePlus[0]);
126        if (sortByTitle) {
127                Comparator<ImagePlus> cmp = new Comparator<ImagePlus>() {
128                        @Override
129                                public int compare(ImagePlus impA, ImagePlus impB) {
130                                return impA.getTitle().compareTo(impB.getTitle());
131                        }
132                };
133                Arrays.sort(impArr, cmp);
134        }
135                return impArr;
136        }
137        
138        @SuppressWarnings("unused")
139        private static String encodeURL(String url) {
140                //url = url.replaceAll(" ","%20");      // this doesn't work with spaces
141                url = url.replace('\\','/');
142                return url;
143        }
144        
145        //----------------------------------------------------------------------
146        
147
148        /**
149         * Creates an ImageJ {@link ImagePlus} image for the matrix {@code M[r][c]} (2D
150         * array), where {@code r} is treated as the row (vertical) coordinate and
151         * {@code c} is treated as the column (horizontal) coordinate. Use
152         * {@code show()} to display the resulting image.
153         * 
154         * @param title image title
155         * @param M     2D array
156         * @return a new {@link ImagePlus} image
157         */
158        public static ImagePlus createImage(String title, float[][] M) {
159                FloatProcessor fp = new FloatProcessor(M[0].length, M.length);
160                for (int u = 0; u < M[0].length; u++) {
161                        for (int v = 0; v < M.length; v++) {
162                                fp.setf(u, v, M[v][u]);
163                        }
164                }
165                return new ImagePlus(title, fp);
166        }
167        
168
169        /**
170         * Creates an ImageJ {@link ImagePlus} image for the matrix {@code M[r][c]} (2D
171         * array), where {@code r} is treated as the row (vertical) coordinate and
172         * {@code c} is treated as the column (horizontal) coordinate. Use
173         * {@code show()} to display the resulting image.
174         * 
175         * @param title the image title
176         * @param M     a 2D array holding the image data
177         * @return a new {@link ImagePlus} instance
178         */
179        public static ImagePlus createImage(String title, double[][] M) {
180                FloatProcessor fp = new FloatProcessor(M[0].length, M.length);
181                for (int u = 0; u < M[0].length; u++) {
182                        for (int v = 0; v < M.length; v++) {
183                                fp.setf(u, v, (float) M[v][u]);
184                        }
185                }
186                return new ImagePlus(title, fp);
187        }
188        
189        /**
190         * Sets the weighing factors for the color components used in RGB-to-grayscale
191         * conversion for the specified image {@code ip}. Note that this method can be
192         * applied to any {@link ImageProcessor} instance but has no effect unless
193         * {@code ip} is of type {@link ColorProcessor}. Applies standard (ITU-709)
194         * weights.
195         * 
196         * @param ip the affected image
197         */
198        public static void setRgbConversionWeights(ImageProcessor ip) {
199                setRgbConversionWeights(ip, 0.299, 0.587, 0.114);
200        }
201        
202        /**
203         * Sets the weighing factors for the color components used in RGB-to-grayscale
204         * conversion for the specified image {@code ip}. Note that this method can be
205         * applied to any {@link ImageProcessor} instance but has no effect unless
206         * {@code ip} is of type {@link ColorProcessor}.
207         * 
208         * @param ip the affected image
209         * @param wr red component weight
210         * @param wg green component weight
211         * @param wb blue component weight
212         */
213        public static void setRgbConversionWeights(ImageProcessor ip, double wr, double wg, double wb) {
214                if (ip instanceof ColorProcessor) {
215                        ((ColorProcessor) ip).setRGBWeights(wr, wg, wb);
216                }
217        }
218        
219        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
220        
221        /**
222         * Extracts (crops) a rectangular region from the given image and returns it as
223         * a new image (of the same sub-type of {@link ImageProcessor}). If the
224         * specified rectangle extends outside the source image, only the overlapping
225         * region is cropped. Thus the returned image may have smaller size than the
226         * specified rectangle. An exception is thrown if the specified width or height
227         * is less than 1. {@code null} is returned if the rectangle does not overlap
228         * the image at all.
229         * 
230         * @param <T>    the generic image type
231         * @param ip     the image to be cropped
232         * @param x      the left corner coordinate of the cropping rectangle
233         * @param y      the top corner coordinate of the cropping rectangle
234         * @param width  the width of the cropping rectangle
235         * @param height the height of the cropping rectangle
236         * @return the cropped image
237         */
238        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
239        public static <T extends ImageProcessor> T crop(T ip, int x, int y, int width, int height) {
240//              if (x < 0 || x >= ip.getWidth() || y < 0 || y >= ip.getHeight()) {
241//                      throw new IllegalArgumentException("(x,y) must be inside the image");
242//              }
243                if (width < 1 || height < 1) {
244                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("crop width/height must be at least 1");
245                }
246//              if (x + width > ip.getWidth() || y + height > ip.getHeight()) {
247//                      throw new IllegalArgumentException("crop rectangle must not extend outside image");
248//              }
249                T ipc = null;
250                synchronized (ip) {
251                        Rectangle roiOrig = ip.getRoi();
252                        ip.setRoi(x, y, width, height);
253                        Rectangle roiTmp = ip.getRoi();
254                        if (roiTmp.width > 0 && roiTmp.height > 0) {
255                                ipc = (T) ip.crop();
256                        }
257                        else {
258                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("empty crop rectangle");
259                        }
260                        ip.setRoi(roiOrig);
261                }
262                return ipc;
263        }
264        
265        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
266        
267        /**
268         * Returns a copy of the pixel data as a 2D double array with dimensions [x =
269         * 0,..,width-1][y = 0,..,height-1].
270         * 
271         * @param fp the image
272         * @return the resulting array
273         */
274        public static double[][] toDoubleArray(FloatProcessor fp) {
275                final int width = fp.getWidth();
276                final int height = fp.getHeight();
277                float[] fPixels = (float[]) fp.getPixels();
278                double[][] dPixels = new double[width][height];
279                int i = 0;
280                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
281                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
282                                dPixels[u][v] = fPixels[i];
283                                i++;
284                        }
285                }
286                return dPixels;
287        }
288        
289        /**
290         * Creates a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance of size width x height
291         * from the given {@code double[][]} with dimensions 
292         * [x = 0,..,width-1][y = 0,..,height-1].
293         * 
294         * @param A a 2D {@code double} array
295         * @return a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance
296         */
297        public static FloatProcessor toFloatProcessor(double[][] A) {
298                final int width = A.length;
299                final int height = A[0].length;
300                float[] fPixels = new float[width * height];
301                int i = 0;
302                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
303                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
304                                fPixels[i] = (float) A[u][v];
305                                i++;
306                        }
307                }
308                return new FloatProcessor(width, height, fPixels);
309        }
310        
311        /**
312         * Creates a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance of size width x height
313         * from the given {@code float[][]} with dimensions 
314         * [x = 0,..,width-1][y = 0,..,height-1].
315         * 
316         * @param A a 2D {@code float} array
317         * @return a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance
318         */
319        public static FloatProcessor toFloatProcessor(float[][] A) {
320//              final int width = A.length;
321//              final int height = A[0].length;
322//              float[] fPixels = new float[width * height];
323//              int i = 0;
324//              for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
325//                      for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
326//                              fPixels[i] = A[u][v];
327//                              i++;
328//                      }
329//              }
330//              return new FloatProcessor(width, height, fPixels);
331                return new FloatProcessor(A);
332        }
333        
334        /**
335         * Converts a {@link FloatProcessor} to a {@code float[][]}.
336         * 
337         * @param fp a {@link FloatProcessor}
338         * @return the resulting {@code float[][]}
339         */
340        public static float[][] toFloatArray(FloatProcessor fp) {
341                return fp.getFloatArray();
342        }
343        
344        /**
345         * Converts the given RGB {@link ColorProcessor} to a scalar-valued
346         * {@link ByteProcessor}, using clearly specified RGB component weights. The
347         * processor's individual RGB component weights are used if they have been set
348         * (not null), otherwise ITU709 weights (see {@link RgbUtils#ITU709RgbWeights})
349         * are applied. This is to avoid problems with standard conversion methods in
350         * ImageJ, which depend on a variety of factors (including current user
351         * settings). See also {@link ColorProcessor#getRGBWeights()},
352         * {@link ColorProcessor#setRGBWeights(double[])},
353         * {@link ImageProcessor#convertToByteProcessor()}.
354         * 
355         * @param cp a {@link ColorProcessor}
356         * @return the resulting {@link ByteProcessor}
357         * @see #toByteProcessor(ColorProcessor, double[])
358         */
359        public static ByteProcessor toByteProcessor(ColorProcessor cp) {
360                if (cp.getRGBWeights() == null) {       // no weights are set
361                        return toByteProcessor(cp, null);
362                }
363                else {  // use the FloatProcessor's individual weights
364                        return cp.convertToByteProcessor();
365                }
366        }
367        
368        /**
369         * Converts the given RGB {@link ColorProcessor} to a scalar-valued
370         * {@link ByteProcessor}, applying the specified set of RGB component weights.
371         * The processor's individual weights (if set) are ignored. This is to avoid
372         * problems with standard conversion methods in ImageJ, which depend on a
373         * variety of factors (including current user settings). See also
374         * {@link ColorProcessor#getRGBWeights()},
375         * {@link ColorProcessor#setRGBWeights(double[])},
376         * {@link ImageProcessor#convertToByteProcessor()}.
377         * 
378         * @param cp         a {@link ColorProcessor}
379         * @param rgbWeights a 3-vector of RGB component weights (must sum to 1)
380         * @return the resulting {@link ByteProcessor}
381         * @see RgbUtils#ITU601RgbWeights
382         * @see RgbUtils#ITU709RgbWeights
383         */
384        public static ByteProcessor toByteProcessor(ColorProcessor cp, double[] rgbWeights) {
385                if (rgbWeights == null) {
386                        rgbWeights = RgbUtils.getDefaultWeights();
387                }
388                if (rgbWeights.length != 3) {
389                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("rgbWeights must be of length 3");
390                }
391                double[] oldweights = cp.getRGBWeights();
392                cp.setRGBWeights(rgbWeights);
393                ByteProcessor bp = cp.convertToByteProcessor();
394                cp.setRGBWeights(oldweights);
395                return bp;
396        }
397        
398        /**
399         * Converts the given RGB {@link ColorProcessor} to a scalar-valued
400         * {@link FloatProcessor}, using clearly specified RGB component weights. The
401         * processor's individual RGB component weights are used if set, otherweise
402         * default weights are used (see {@link RgbUtils#getDefaultWeights()}). This
403         * should avoid problems with standard conversion methods in ImageJ, which
404         * depend on a variety of factors (including current user settings). See also
405         * {@link ColorProcessor#getRGBWeights()},
406         * {@link ColorProcessor#setRGBWeights(double[])},
407         * {@link ImageProcessor#convertToFloatProcessor()}.
408         * 
409         * @param cp a {@link ColorProcessor}
410         * @return the resulting {@link FloatProcessor}
411         * @see #toFloatProcessor(ColorProcessor, double[])
412         */
413        public static FloatProcessor toFloatProcessor(ColorProcessor cp) {
414                if (cp.getRGBWeights() == null) {       // no weights are set
415                        return toFloatProcessor(cp, null);
416                }
417                else {  // use the FloatProcessor's individual weights
418                        return cp.convertToFloatProcessor();
419                }
420        }
421        
422        /**
423         * Converts the given RGB {@link ColorProcessor} to a scalar-valued
424         * {@link FloatProcessor}, applying the specified set of RGB component weights.
425         * If {@code null} is passed for the weights, default weights are used (see
426         * {@link RgbUtils#getDefaultWeights()}). The processor's individual weights (if
427         * set at all) are ignored. This should avoid problems with standard conversion
428         * methods in ImageJ, which depend on a variety of factors (including current
429         * user settings). See also {@link ColorProcessor#getRGBWeights()},
430         * {@link ColorProcessor#setRGBWeights(double[])},
431         * {@link ImageProcessor#convertToFloatProcessor()}.
432         * 
433         * @param cp         a {@link ColorProcessor}
434         * @param rgbWeights a 3-vector of RGB component weights (must sum to 1)
435         * @return the resulting {@link FloatProcessor}
436         * @see RgbUtils#ITU601RgbWeights
437         * @see RgbUtils#ITU709RgbWeights
438         */
439        public static FloatProcessor toFloatProcessor(ColorProcessor cp, double[] rgbWeights) {
440                if (rgbWeights == null) {
441                        rgbWeights = RgbUtils.getDefaultWeights();
442                }
443                if (rgbWeights.length != 3) {
444                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("rgbWeights must be of length 3");
445                }
446                double[] oldweights = cp.getRGBWeights();
447                cp.setRGBWeights(rgbWeights);
448                FloatProcessor fp = cp.convertToFloatProcessor();
449                cp.setRGBWeights(oldweights);
450                return fp;
451        }
452        
453        /**
454         * Creates and returns a new {@link ByteProcessor} from the specified 2D
455         * {@code byte} array, assumed to be arranged in the form {@code A[x][y]}, i.e.,
456         * the first coordinate is horizontal, the second vertical. Thus
457         * {@code A.length} is the width and {@code A[0].length} the height of the
458         * resulting image.
459         * 
460         * @param A a 2D {@code byte} array
461         * @return a new {@link ByteProcessor} of size {@code A.length} x
462         *         {@code A[0].length}
463         */
464        public static ByteProcessor toByteProcessor(byte[][] A) {
465                final int w = A.length;
466                final int h = A[0].length;
467                ByteProcessor bp = new ByteProcessor(w, h);
468                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
469                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
470                                bp.putPixel(u, v, 0xFF & A[u][v]);
471                        }
472                }
473                return bp;
474        }
475        
476        /**
477         * Creates and returns a new {@code byte[][]} from the specified
478         * {@link ByteProcessor}. The resulting array is arranged in the form
479         * {@code A[x][y]}, i.e., the first coordinate is horizontal, the second
480         * vertical. Thus {@code A.length} is the width and {@code A[0].length} the
481         * height of the image.
482         * 
483         * @param bp a {@link ByteProcessor}
484         * @return a 2D {@code byte} array
485         */
486        public static byte[][] toByteArray(ByteProcessor bp) {
487                final int w = bp.getWidth();
488                final int h = bp.getHeight();
489                byte[][] A = new byte[w][h];
490                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
491                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
492                                A[u][v] =  (byte) (0xFF & bp.get(u, v));
493                        }
494                }
495                return A;
496        }
497        
498        /**
499         * Creates and returns a new {@link ByteProcessor} from the specified 2D
500         * {@code int} array, assumed to be arranged in the form {@code A[x][y]}, i.e.,
501         * the first coordinate is horizontal, the second vertical. Thus
502         * {@code A.length} is the width and {@code A[0].length} the height of the
503         * resulting image. Pixel values are clamped to [0, 255].
504         * 
505         * @param A a 2D {@code int} array
506         * @return a new {@link ByteProcessor} of size {@code A.length} x
507         *         {@code A[0].length}
508         */
509        public static ByteProcessor toByteProcessor(int[][] A) {
510                final int w = A.length;
511                final int h = A[0].length;
512                ByteProcessor bp = new ByteProcessor(w, h);
513                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
514                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
515                                int val = A[u][v];
516                                if (val < 0)
517                                        val = 0;
518                                else if (val > 255) 
519                                        val = 255;
520                                bp.putPixel(u, v, val);
521                        }
522                }
523                return bp;
524        }
525        
526        /**
527         * Creates and returns a new {@code int[][]} from the specified
528         * {@link ByteProcessor}. The resulting array is arranged in the form
529         * {@code A[x][y]}, i.e., the first coordinate is horizontal, the second
530         * vertical. Thus {@code A.length} is the width and {@code A[0].length} the
531         * height of the image.
532         * 
533         * @param bp a {@link ByteProcessor}
534         * @return a 2D {@code int} array
535         */
536        public static int[][] toIntArray(ByteProcessor bp) {
537                return bp.getIntArray();
538        }
539        
540        /**
541         * Opens the image from the specified {@link URI} and returns it as a
542         * {@link ImagePlus} instance.
543         * 
544         * @param uri the URI leading to the image (including extension)
545         * @return a new {@link ImagePlus} instance or {@code null} if unable to open
546         */
547        public static ImagePlus openImage(URI uri) {
548                Objects.requireNonNull(uri);
549                return new Opener().openImage(uri.toString());
550        }
551        
552        /**
553         * Opens the image from the specified filename and returns it as a
554         * {@link ImagePlus} instance.
555         * 
556         * @param filename the path and filename to be opened
557         * @return a new {@link ImagePlus} instance or {@code null} if unable to open
558         */
559        public static ImagePlus openImage(String filename) {
560                return openImage(new File(filename).toURI());
561        }
562        
563        
564        // Methods for checking/comparing images (primarily used for testing)  ---------------------
565        
566        /**
567         * Checks if two images are of the same type.
568         * 
569         * @param ip1 the first image
570         * @param ip2 the second image
571         * @return true if both images have the same type
572         */
573        public static boolean sameType(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2) {
574                return ip1.getClass().equals(ip2.getClass());
575        }
576        
577        /**
578         * Checks if two images have the same size.
579         * 
580         * @param ip1 the first image
581         * @param ip2 the second image
582         * @return true if both images have the same size
583         */
584        public static boolean sameSize(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2) {
585                return ip1.getWidth() == ip2.getWidth() && ip1.getHeight() == ip2.getHeight();
586        }
587        
588        /**
589         * Checks if the given image is possibly a binary image. This requires that the
590         * image contains at most two different pixel values, one of which must be zero.
591         * All pixels are checked. This should work for all image types. More efficient
592         * implementations are certainly possible.
593         * 
594         * @param ip the image ({@link ImageProcessor}) to be checked
595         * @return true if the image is binary
596         */
597        public static boolean isBinary(ImageProcessor ip) {
598                final int width = ip.getWidth();
599                final int height = ip.getHeight();
600                int fgVal = 0;
601                boolean binary = true;
602                
603                outer:
604                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
605                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
606                                int val = 0x007FFFFF & ip.get(u, v); // = mantissa in case of float
607                                if (val != 0) {
608                                        if (fgVal == 0) {       // first non-zero value
609                                                fgVal = val;
610                                        }
611                                        else if (val != fgVal) {        // found another non-zero value
612                                                binary = false;
613                                                break outer;
614                                        }
615                                }
616                        }
617                }
618                
619                return binary;
620        }
621        
622        /**
623         * Checks if the given image is "flat", i.e., all pixels have the same value.
624         * This should work for all image types.
625         * 
626         * @param ip the image ({@link ImageProcessor}) to be checked
627         * @return true if the image is flat
628         */
629        public static boolean isFlat(ImageProcessor ip) {
630                final int width = ip.getWidth();
631                final int height = ip.getHeight();
632                boolean flat = true;
633                int fgVal = ip.get(0, 0);
634                
635                outer:
636                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
637                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
638                                int val = ip.get(u, v);
639                                if (val != fgVal) {
640                                        flat = false;
641                                        break outer;
642                                }
643                        }
644                }
645                
646                return flat;
647        }
648        
649        /**
650         * Collects all image coordinates with non-zero pixel values into an array
651         * of 2D points ({@link Pnt2d}).
652         * 
653         * @param ip an image (of any type)
654         * @return an array of 2D points
655         */
656        public static Pnt2d[] collectNonzeroPoints(ImageProcessor ip) {
657                List<Pnt2d> points = new ArrayList<>();
658                int M = ip.getWidth();
659                int N = ip.getHeight();
660                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
661                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
662                                int val = 0x007FFFFF & ip.get(u, v); // = mantissa in case of float
663                                if (val != 0) {
664                                        points.add(PntInt.from(u, v));
665                                }
666                        }
667                }
668                return points.toArray(new Pnt2d[0]);
669        }
670        
671        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
672        
673        public static final double DefaultMatchTolerance = 1E-6;
674        
675        /**
676         * Checks if two images have the same type, size and content (using
677         * {@link #DefaultMatchTolerance} for float images).
678         * 
679         * @param ip1 the first image
680         * @param ip2 the second image
681         * @return true if both images have the same type and content
682         */
683        public static boolean match(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2) {
684                // TODO: check redundancy with ImageTestUtils.match() - same names but slightly differently implemented!
685                return match(ip1, ip2, DefaultMatchTolerance);
686        }
687        
688        /**
689         * Checks if two images have the same type, size and values (using the specified
690         * tolerance for float images).
691         * 
692         * @param ip1       the first image
693         * @param ip2       the second image
694         * @param tolerance the matching tolerance
695         * @return true if both images have the same type, size and content
696         */
697        public static boolean match(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2, double tolerance) {
698                if (!sameType(ip1, ip2)) {
699                        return false;
700                }
701                if (!sameSize(ip1, ip2)) {
702                        return false;
703                }
704                
705                if (ip1 instanceof ByteProcessor) {
706                        return Arrays.equals((byte[]) ip1.getPixels(), (byte[]) ip2.getPixels());
707                }
708                else if (ip1 instanceof ShortProcessor) {
709                        return Arrays.equals((short[]) ip1.getPixels(), (short[]) ip2.getPixels());
710                }
711                else if (ip1 instanceof ColorProcessor) {
712                        return Arrays.equals((int[]) ip1.getPixels(), (int[]) ip2.getPixels());
713                }
714                
715                else if (ip1 instanceof FloatProcessor) {
716                        final float[] p1 = (float[]) ip1.getPixels();
717                        final float[] p2 = (float[]) ip2.getPixels();
718                        final float toleranceF = (float) tolerance;
719                        boolean same = true;
720                        for (int i = 0; i < p1.length; i++) {
721                                if (Math.abs(p1[i] - p2[i]) > toleranceF) {
722                                        same = false;
723                                        break;
724                                }
725                        }
726                        return same;
727                }
728
729                throw new IllegalArgumentException("unknown processor type " + ip1.getClass().getSimpleName());
730        }
731        
732        // BitMap from/to ByteProcessor conversion
733        /**
734         * Converts the specified {@link ByteProcessor} to a {@link BitMap} of the same
735         * size, with all zero values set to 0 and non-zero values set to 1.
736         * 
737         * @param bp a {@link ByteProcessor}
738         * @return the corresponding {@link BitMap}
739         * @see #convertToByteProcessor(BitMap)
740         */
741        public static BitMap convertToBitMap(ByteProcessor bp) {
742                return new BitMap(bp.getWidth(), bp.getHeight(), (byte[]) bp.getPixels());
743        }
744
745        /**
746         * <p>
747         * Converts the specified {@link BitMap} to a {@link ByteProcessor} of the same
748         * size, with all zero values set to 0 and non-zero values set to 1. The
749         * resulting image should be multiplied by 255 to achieve full contrast, e.g.:
750         * </p>
751         * <pre>
752         * ByteProcessor bp1 = ... // some ByteProcessor
753         * BitMap bm = IjUtils.convertToBitMap(bp);
754         * ByteProcessor bp2 = IjUtils.convertToByteProcessor(bm);
755         * bp2.multiply(255);
756         * ...
757         * </pre>
758         * 
759         * @param bitmap a {@link BitMap}
760         * @return the corresponding {@link ByteProcessor}
761         * @see #convertToBitMap(ByteProcessor)
762         */
763        public static ByteProcessor convertToByteProcessor(BitMap bitmap) {
764                byte[] pixels = bitmap.getBitVector().toByteArray();
765                return new ByteProcessor(bitmap.getWidth(), bitmap.getHeight(), pixels);
766        }
767        
768        /**
769         * Draws the given set of points onto the specified image (by setting the
770         * corresponding pixels).
771         * 
772         * @param ip     the image to draw to
773         * @param points the 2D points
774         * @param value  the pixel value to use
775         */
776        public static void drawPoints(ImageProcessor ip, Pnt2d[] points, int value) {
777                for (int i = 0; i < points.length; i++) {
778                        Pnt2d p = points[i];
779                        if (p != null) {
780                                int u = p.getXint();
781                                int v = p.getYint();
782                                ip.putPixel(u, v, value);
783                        }
784                }
785        }
786        
787        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
788        
789        /**
790         * Runs the given {@link PlugInFilter} instance with empty argument string.
791         * 
792         * @param pluginfilter an instance of {@link PlugInFilter}
793         * @return true if no exception was thrown
794         */
795        public static boolean run(PlugInFilter pluginfilter) {
796                return run(pluginfilter, "");
797        }
798        
799        /**
800         * Runs the given {@link PlugInFilter} instance.
801         * 
802         * @param pluginfilter an instance of {@link PlugInFilter}
803         * @param arg          argument passed to
804         *                     {@link PlugInFilter#setup(String, ImagePlus)}
805         * @return true if no exception was thrown
806         */
807        public static boolean run(PlugInFilter pluginfilter, String arg) {
808                try {
809                        new PlugInFilterRunner(pluginfilter, pluginfilter.getClass().getSimpleName(), arg);
810                } catch (Exception e) {
811                        return false;
812                }
813                return true;
814        }
815        
816        /**
817         * Runs the given {@link PlugIn} instance with empty argument string.
818         * 
819         * @param plugin an instance of {@link PlugIn}
820         * @return true if no exception was thrown
821         */
822        public static boolean run(PlugIn plugin) {
823                return run(plugin, "");
824        }
825        
826        /**
827         * Runs the given {@link PlugIn} instance.
828         * 
829         * @param plugin an instance of {@link PlugIn}
830         * @param arg    argument passed to {@link PlugIn#run(String)}
831         * @return true if no exception was thrown
832         */
833        public static boolean run(PlugIn plugin, String arg) {
834                try {
835                        plugin.run(arg);
836                } catch (Exception e) {
837                        return false;
838                }
839                return true;
840        }
841        
842        // ------------------------------------------------------------------
843        
844        /**
845         * Run a {@link PlugInFilter} from the associated class with empty argument
846         * string. If the plugin's constructor is available, use method
847         * {@link #run(PlugInFilter)} instead.
848         * 
849         * @param clazz class of the pluginfilter
850         * @return true if no exception was thrown
851         */
852        public static boolean runPlugInFilter(Class<? extends PlugInFilter> clazz) {
853                return runPlugInFilter(clazz, "");
854        }
855        
856        /**
857         * Run a {@link PlugInFilter} from the associated class. If the plugin's
858         * constructor is available, use method {@link #run(PlugInFilter, String)}
859         * instead.
860         * 
861         * @param clazz class of the plugin
862         * @param arg   argument string
863         * @return true if no exception was thrown
864         */
865        public static boolean runPlugInFilter(Class<? extends PlugInFilter> clazz, String arg) {
866                PlugInFilter thePlugIn = null;
867                try {
868                        thePlugIn = clazz.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
869                } catch (InstantiationException | IllegalAccessException | IllegalArgumentException
870                                | InvocationTargetException | NoSuchMethodException | SecurityException e) {
871                        throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());     // should never happen
872                }
873                return run(thePlugIn, arg);
874        }
875        
876        /**
877         * Run a {@link PlugIn} from the associated class with empty argument string. If
878         * the plugin's constructor is available, use method {@link #run(PlugIn)}
879         * instead.
880         * 
881         * @param clazz class of the plugin
882         * @return true if no exception was thrown
883         */
884        public static boolean runPlugIn(Class<? extends PlugIn> clazz) {
885                return runPlugIn(clazz, "");
886        }
887        
888        /**
889         * Run a {@link PlugIn} from the associated class. If the plugin's constructor
890         * is available, use method {@link #run(PlugIn, String)} instead.
891         * 
892         * @param clazz class of the plugin
893         * @param arg   argument string
894         * @return true if no exception was thrown
895         */
896        public static boolean runPlugIn(Class<? extends PlugIn> clazz, String arg) {
897                PlugIn thePlugIn = null;
898                try {
899                        thePlugIn = clazz.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
900                } catch (InstantiationException | IllegalAccessException | IllegalArgumentException
901                                | InvocationTargetException | NoSuchMethodException | SecurityException e) {
902                        throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());     // should never happen
903                }
904                return run(thePlugIn, arg);
905        }
906
907        
908        //  static methods for filtering images using ImageJ's {@link Convolver} class. 
909
910        /**
911         * Applies a one-dimensional convolution kernel to the given image, which is
912         * modified. The 1D kernel is applied in horizontal direction only.# The
913         * supplied filter kernel is not normalized.
914         * 
915         * @param ip the image to be filtered (modified)
916         * @param h  the filter kernel
917         * @see Convolver
918         */
919        public static void convolveX (ImageProcessor ip, float[] h) { // TODO: unit test missing
920                Convolver conv = new Convolver();
921                conv.setNormalize(false);
922                conv.convolve(ip, h, h.length, 1);
923        }
924
925        /**
926         * Applies a one-dimensional convolution kernel to the given image, which is
927         * modified. The 1D kernel is applied in vertical direction only. The supplied
928         * filter kernel must be odd-sized. It is not normalized.
929         * 
930         * @param ip the image to be filtered (modified)
931         * @param h  the filter kernel
932         * @see Convolver
933         */
934        public static void convolveY (ImageProcessor ip, float[] h) {
935                Convolver conv = new Convolver();
936                conv.setNormalize(false);
937                conv.convolve(ip, h, 1, h.length);
938        }
939
940        /**
941         * Applies a one-dimensional convolution kernel to the given image, which is
942         * modified. The same 1D kernel is applied twice, once in horizontal and once in
943         * vertical direction. The supplied filter kernel must be odd-sized. It is not
944         * normalized.
945         * 
946         * @param ip the image to be filtered (modified)
947         * @param h  the filter kernel
948         * @see Convolver
949         */
950        public static void convolveXY (ImageProcessor ip, float[] h) {
951                Convolver conv = new Convolver();
952                conv.setNormalize(false);
953                conv.convolve(ip, h, h.length, 1);
954                conv.convolve(ip, h, 1, h.length);
955        }
956        
957        /**
958         * Applies a two-dimensional convolution kernel to the given image, which is
959         * modified. The supplied kernel {@code float[x][y]} must be rectangular and
960         * odd-sized. It is not normalized.
961         * 
962         * @param ip the image to be filtered (modified)
963         * @param H  the filter kernel
964         */
965        public static void convolve(ImageProcessor ip, float[][] H) {
966                float[] h = Matrix.flatten(H);  // TODO: right order? transpose?
967                Convolver conv = new Convolver();
968                conv.setNormalize(false);
969                conv.convolve(ip, h, H[0].length, H.length);
970        }
971        
972        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
973        
974        /**
975         * Saves the given {@link ImageProcessor} using the specified path. The image
976         * file type is inferred from the file extension. TIFF is used if no file
977         * extension is given. This method simply invokes
978         * {@link IJ#save(ImagePlus, String)}, creating a temporary and titleless
979         * {@link ImagePlus} instance. Existing files with the same path are
980         * overwritten.
981         * 
982         * @param ip       a {@link ImageProcessor}
983         * @param filepath the path where to save the image, e.g.
984         *                 {@code "C:/tmp/MyImage.png"}
985         * @return the absolute file path
986         */
987        public static String save(ImageProcessor ip, String filepath) {
988                Objects.requireNonNull(filepath);
989                // TODO: check if the file was actually written or not
990                File file = Paths.get(filepath).toFile();
991                String absPath = file.getAbsolutePath();
992                IJ.save(new ImagePlus("", ip), absPath);
993                return absPath;
994        }
995        
996        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
997        
998        /**
999         * Returns true if no image is currently open in ImageJ.
1000         * 
1001         * @return true if no image is open
1002         */
1003        public static boolean noCurrentImage() {
1004                return (WindowManager.getCurrentImage() == null);
1005        }
1006        
1007        /**
1008         * <p>
1009         * Returns true if the current (active) image is compatible with the specified
1010         * flags (as specified by {@link PlugInFilter}, typically used to compose the
1011         * return value of {@link PlugInFilter#setup(String, ImagePlus)}). This method
1012         * emulates the compatibility check performed by ImageJ's built-in
1013         * {@link PlugInFilterRunner} before a {@link PlugInFilter} is executed. It may
1014         * be used, e.g., in the (normally empty) constructor of a class implementing
1015         * {@link PlugInFilter}.
1016         * </p>
1017         * <p>
1018         * Example, checking if the current image is either 8-bit or 32-bit gray:
1019         * </p>
1020         * <pre>
1021         * if (checkImageFlagsCurrent(PlugInFilter.DOES_8G + PlugInFilter.DOES_32)) {
1022         *      // some action ...
1023         * }
1024         * </pre>
1025         * 
1026         * @param flags int-encoded binary flags
1027         * @return true if the current image is compatible
1028         * @see PlugInFilter
1029         * @see #checkImageFlags(ImagePlus, int)
1030         */
1031        public static boolean checkImageFlagsCurrent(int flags) {
1032                return checkImageFlags(WindowManager.getCurrentImage(), flags);
1033        }
1034        
1035        /**
1036         * <p>
1037         * Returns true if the given image is compatible with the specified flags (as
1038         * specified by {@link PlugInFilter}, typically used to compose the return value
1039         * of {@link PlugInFilter#setup(String, ImagePlus)}). Usage example:
1040         * </p>
1041         * <pre>
1042         * ImagePlus im = WindowManager.getCurrentImage(); // may be null
1043         * if (checkImageFlags(im, PlugInFilter.DOES_8G + PlugInFilter.DOES_RGB)) {
1044         *      // some action
1045         * }
1046         * </pre>
1047         * 
1048         * @param im    a {@link ImagePlus} or {@code null}
1049         * @param flags int-encoded binary flags
1050         * @return true if the image is compatible
1051         * @see PlugInFilter
1052         */
1053        public static boolean checkImageFlags(ImagePlus im, int flags) {
1054                // if no image is required, no more checks are needed:
1055                if ((flags & PlugInFilter.NO_IMAGE_REQUIRED) != 0) {
1056                        return true;
1057                }
1058                // void if no active image or one without a processor:
1059                if (im == null || im.getProcessor() == null) {
1060                        return false;
1061                }
1062                // check if the image type is compatible:
1063                if (!checkImageType(im, flags)) {
1064                        return false;
1065                }
1066                // check if im is a stack, if required:
1067                if (((flags & PlugInFilter.STACK_REQUIRED) != 0) && !im.hasImageStack()) {
1068                        return false;
1069                }
1070                // all checks passed:
1071                return true;
1072        }
1073        
1074        private static boolean checkImageType(ImagePlus im, int flags) {
1075                switch (im.getType()) {
1076                case ImagePlus.GRAY8:
1077                        return ((flags & PlugInFilter.DOES_8G) != 0);
1078                case ImagePlus.COLOR_256:
1079                        return ((flags & PlugInFilter.DOES_8C) != 0);
1080                case ImagePlus.GRAY16:
1081                        return ((flags & PlugInFilter.DOES_16) != 0);
1082                case ImagePlus.GRAY32:
1083                        return ((flags & PlugInFilter.DOES_32) != 0);           
1084                case ImagePlus.COLOR_RGB:
1085                        return ((flags & PlugInFilter.DOES_RGB) != 0);
1086                default:
1087                        return false;
1088                }
1089        }
1090        
1091}
